ai-tha-ap324:1.1_0: Oh, when will I live serene,
ai-tha-ap324:1.2_0: like a flame in the wind.
ai-tha-ap324:1.3_0: like the sun shining in the sick,
ai-tha-ap324:2.1_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap324:3.2_0: like one who goes to the road,
ai-tha-ap324:3.4_0: such a one, the great hermit,
ai-tha-ap324:4.1_0: For this he got half the bride-price
ai-tha-ap324:4.3_0: I spent the day in order.
ai-tha-ap324:4.4_0: the poised one, the perfected one;
ai-tha-ap324:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap324:5.4_0: this is the fellow of the fruit.
ai-tha-ap324:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pūraṇa Kassapa.
ai-tha-ap324:8.1_0: to the Elder Nun Pūraṇa Kassapa
